name: State_7

timeline_beats.label: Territorial shifts after the Great Naval War

factions.label: Harbor Merchant Council
factions.influence_hint: Controls trade policy, port tariffs, foreign dealings

factions.label: Seafarers' Brotherhood
factions.influence_hint: Manages navigation guilds, ship crews, coastal militias

factions.label: Coastal Patriciate
factions.influence_hint: Hereditary land-owning elites, controls fortifications and hinterland leases

factions.label: Tide-Speakers (clergy)
factions.influence_hint: Influences ritually-sanctioned voyages and reagent access

factions.label: Smugglers' Networks
factions.influence_hint: Shadow economy; seasonal spikes during embargoes and wars

traits: oral sea-shanty and port folklore tradition
practical seamanship emphasized over pure augury
bilingual trading argot with Island Creole influences

external_relations_refs.label_hint: Territorial Shifts after Great Naval War

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned
Navigational auguries exist but cannot replace charts and seamanship
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs
State must remain coastal in geography and economy
notes: Primary reliance on imported reagents; port access critical for stability
Guild autonomy strongâ€”central authority negotiated via Merchant Council
Border stability remains fragile after BC4; coastal fortresses concentrated at chokepoints
Seasonal monsoon/coastal storms drive shipping cycles and ritual calendars
Lower layers should track reagent supply lines, shipyard capacity, and alliance obligations under A2
